From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To clear the parse cache entries and hit/miss statistics stored for the Parser Cache feature, use the **clearÂ parser cache** command in privileged EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example shows the clearing of the parser cache:
Last configuration file parsed:Number of Commands:1484, Time:820 ms
Last configuration file parsed:Number of Commands:1484, Time:820 ms
ExtraInfo: The Parser Cache feature optimizes the parsing (translation and execution) of Cisco IOS software configuration command lines by remembering how to parse recently encountered command lines, decreasing the time required to process large configuration files.The **clear parser cache** command will free the system memory used by the Parser Cache feature and will erase the hit/miss statistics stored for the output of the **show parser statistics** EXEC command. This command is only effective when the Parser Cache feature is enabled.

RelatedCmds.description: Enables or disables the Parser Cache feature.
Displays statistics about the last configuration file parsed and the status of the Parser Cache feature.
